src:
Taj-brejk majstor Kecmanović
Mladi srpski teniser slavio na otvarajućem meču završnog ATP turnira sezone u Milanu za najbolje tenisere do 21 godine

05 Nov 2019

Naš, ali i jedan od najtalentovanijih svetskih tenisera, 20-godišnji Miomir Kecmanović odličnim nastupom otvorio je novo izdanje završnog turnira za najbolje igrače do 21 godine koji se održava u Milanu.
On je u prvom meču na takmičenju koje se igra na tvrdoj podlozi u zatvorenom za nagradni fond od 1,4 miliona dolara savladao svog dobrog prijatelja, momka sa kojim deli hleb i vodi bitke širom sveta već skoro deceniju, Kaspera Ruda rezultatom 4:3 (5), 4:3 (5) i 4:2. To je druga pobeda Kecmanovića u isto toliko okršaja sa Norvežaninom na ATP turu, ujedno i očekivana pošto Srbinu leže uslovi igranja u Milanu, dok je njegov protivnik/prijatelj specijalista za šljaku.
Bez većih problema oba tenisera su držala svoje gemove u prvom delu meču, ali se u taj-brejku, koji se na ovom turniru igra na 3:3, mnogo bolje snašao Beograđanin. Sličan scenario je viđen i u drugom setu u kojem su i Beograđanin i momak iz Osla čuvali svoje servise, da bi sve bilo rešeno u taj-brejku. Istina, ovaj put je Kecmanović bio taj koji je morao da juri prednost protivnika, ali je uspeo da je "ujuri". Završni set nije ušao u taj-brejk pošto je naš došao do brejka u petom gemu, nakon čega je samo potvrdio trijumf.
U zavisnosti od preostalih rezultata, u suštini Miša bi mogao sa još jednom pobedom da računa na polufinale, što je samo po sebi veliki uspeh. Još nije poznat raspored mečeva za sutra, a u Kecmanovićevoj Grupi A nalaze se još Australijanac Aleks de Minor, najveći favorit turnira i aktuleni vicešampion (titulu ne brani Stefanos CicIpas koji učestvuje naredne sedmice na završnom mastersu u Londonu) i Španac Alehandro Davidovič Fokina.
O pravilima i specifičnostima ovog takmičenja, koje pokušava da pokaže u kom pravcu će se kretati beli sport, pročitajte OVDE.

(Foto: Reuters)
text:
Taj-break master Kecmanovic
Young Serbian tennis player celebrates in the opening match of the final ATP tournament of the season in Milan for the best tennis players under 21

05 Nov 2019

Ours, but also one of the most talented players in the world, 20-year-old Miomir Kecmanovic, with a great performance, opened a new edition of the final tournament for the best players under 21, which is being held in Milan.
He defeated his good friend, a guy he shares bread with and has been battling around the world with, for nearly a decade, Casper Rudo in a 4: 3 (4: 3) 5), 4: 3 (5) and 4: 2. This is Kecmanovic's second victory in as much feud with the Norwegian on the ATP tour, as expected since the Serbian is playing in Milan while his opponent / friend is a slag specialist.
Without any major problems, both players held their games in the first leg of the match, but in the tie-break, which is played at 3: 3 in this tournament, the Belgrade man did much better. A similar scenario was seen in the second set, in which both a Belgrade man and a Oslo guy kept their services, so that everything would be settled in a tie-break. True, this time it was Kecmanovic who had to chase the opponent's advantage, but managed to "rush it". The final set did not go into the tie-break as ours came to the break in the fifth game, after which it only confirmed the triumph.
Depending on the results remaining, essentially Misha could count on the semifinals with another win, which in itself is a great success. Kecmanovic's Group A matches are not yet known, with Kecmanovic's Group A also featuring Australia's Alex de Minor, the tournament's biggest favorite and current vice-champion (no defending title Stefanos CicIpas taking part in the final Masters in London next week) and Spaniard Alehandro Davidovich Fokina.
You can read about the rules and specifics of this competition, which is trying to show in which direction white sport is going, HERE.

(Photo by Reuters)
